competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Watson Analytics and enterprise data solutions

competitors.name: SAS
competitors.notes: Traditional analytics and data mining leader

context: In 2015, Palantir was valued at $20B, primarily focused on government and intelligence contracts. The company was expanding into commercial markets with Palantir Foundry while Gotham served government customers. Competition in data analytics was fragmented across BI vendors, data warehousing, and specialized platforms. Palantir differentiated with data integration and analysis for complex, sensitive use cases. The commercial expansion faced challenges against established enterprise analytics vendors.
